meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's time to get our groove on and dive into the world of Street Fighter 6!

As I powered up my console for a marathon session of SF6, I couldn't help but notice all the rave reviews from critics like GameSpot (90), Slant Magazine (100), Gaming Age (91), Vandal (95), SpazioGames (95), and Destructoid (95). It's clear that Capcom has knocked it out of the park with this latest installment.

So, what makes Street Fighter 6 so special? For starters, its beautifully constructed fighting system is a masterclass in game design. The addition of new modes like World Tour takes the series to the next level, offering something for everyone - whether you're a serious competitor or just looking for some mindless fun.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about those pesky performance issues?" Well, let me tell you, they're minor at best. A little lag here and there won't derail the overall package, especially when the game is this good.

In my opinion, Street Fighter 6 is the perfect blend of nostalgic charm and modern innovations. It's a true champion of the fighting game genre, and I'm not just saying that because I spent an entire weekend playing it (okay, maybe I am).

All joking aside, if you're a fan of the series or just looking for a fun, competitive gaming experience, Street Fighter 6 is an absolute must-play. So, grab your controller, get ready to rumble, and remember: Hippo Penny approved!
